child.geography: Widespread. Algeria: Mostly cities. Belgium: Hainaut, Namur, Liège, Luxembourg, Brabant-Walloon provinces, southern hills, and bilingual part of Brussels. Lorraine in Luxembourg Province south. Cameroon: Used mainly in the Littoral, West, Center, South, East, Adamawa, North, and Far North provinces. Canada: Québéco in Quebec; Franco-Ontarien Ontario; Acadian Caraquet; Shippagan, east coast of New Brunswick, pockets in Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island. Some Québécois in Manitoba and Newfoundland. Equatorial Guinea: Mostly cities. Italy: Aosta Valley. New Caledonia: Mainly Noumea. Switzerland: West. United Kingdom: Channel Islands. United States: Massachusetts, Woonsocket Rhode Island, Maine, Connecticut, Manchester New Hampshire, Vermont.

child.geography: Spain: Zaragoza, Uesca Province; Pyrenea (north border), Navarra (west border); north of Montsó (east). Western Aragonese in Ansó, Echo, Chasa, Berdún, and Chaca towns; Central Aragonese in Panticosa, Biescas, Torla, Broto, Bielsa, Yebra, and L’Ainsa; Eastern Aragonese in Benás (Benasque, Benasc, Patués), Plan, Bisagorri, Campo, Perarruga, Graus, Estadilla; Southern Aragonese in Agüero, Ayerbe, Rasal, Bolea, Lierta, Uesca, Almudébar, Nozito, Labata, Alguezra, Angüés, Pertusa, Balbastro, Nabal.
child.pub-comments: "Different from the local variety of Spanish (also called ‘Aragonese’ influenced by High Aragonese)" (Ethnologue 2009).
child.alt-names: Altoaragonés, Aragoieraz, Aragonés, Fabla Aragonesa, High Aragonese, Patués

child.geography: Greece: North, Northwest Salonika, Pindus Mountains, Trikala area. Albania: South, especially in Korçë, Lushnjë, Pernët, Gjirokastër, Sarandë, Berat, Durrës, Kavajë, and Tiranë. Bugaria: Associations in Peshtera, Velingrad, Dupnitsa, Rakitovo, and Blagoevgrad. Macedonia: Skopje, Stip, Bitola, Krusevo, and Struga; Ohrid, Kocani-Vinica, Sveti Nikole, Kumanovo, and Gevgelija. Romania: Southeast, especially Dobrudja (75%); major cities like Bucharest and Constanta. Serbia: Belgrade, Vojvodine and Kosovo. Also in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
child.alt-names: Armina, Arumanian, Macedo Romanian, Macedo-Rumanian, Vlach, Aromunian, Arumun, Macedo Romanian, Macedo, Romanian, Macedo Romania

child.pub-comments: "‘Brokpa’ is used for Shina speakers in Baltistan and Ladakh. ‘Brokskat’ refers to their language and also is used semiofficially in India to refer to a highly divergent variety of Shina spoken by Buddhists." "Distinct from Brokskat [bkk]" (Ethnologue 2009).

child.geography: Widespread. Turkey (Asia): Hakkari, Siirt, Mardin, Agri, Diyarbakir, Bitlis, Bingol, Van, Adiyaman, and Mus, most; also Urfa, Kars, Tunceli, Malatya, Erzurum, Marash, Sivas, and other provinces; communities in central Turkey (Cankiri, Cihanbeyli, near Konya); many in large cities in the west, including Istanbul, Adana, Ankara, Izmir. Afghanistan: Kabul area. Azerbaijan: Basargechar, Minkend, Kubatly, Zangelan, especially Kelbajar and Lachin. Many displaced. Georgia: Tblisi area. Iran: North and west of Lake Urmia. Some in Kalardast region, Mazandaran Province. Northern Kurdish variety of Khorasani Kurmanji is east of the Caspian Sea, in north Khorassan Province, Quchan and Bojnurd towns. Iraq: North of Great Zab River, Dohuk and Mosul provinces. Surchi near Great Zab River. Lebanon: Beirut; Sidon, Tripoli, and Biqa Valley. Syria: Northern Syria: Northern Cizire (Qamishlok), Kurd-Dagh (Ciyayê Kurdî, Afrin), Ain-Arab, Allepo, Damascus. Turkmenistan: Ashkhabad area.
child.alt-names: Kermancî, Kirmancî, Kurdi, Kurdî, Kurmancî, Kurmanji, Êzdîkî, Eastern Kurmanji, Kordi, Badinani, Bahdini, Behdini, Kirmanciya Jori, Khorasani, Khorasani Kurmanji

child.geography: Iran: Widespread. Most concentrated in central, south central, and northeast. Oman: Scattered coastal cities. Mutrah area, Jabroo community, toward Ruwi. Paraguay: Chaco and east: Filadelfia, Menno Colony, Loma Plata, Neuland. United States: Hillsboro, Kansas; Reedley, California; and Corn, Oklahoma. child.geography: Austria: Central Bavarian in the Alps and Lower Austria and Salzburg; North Bavarian north of Regensburg, to Nuremburg and Western Bohemia, Czech Republic; South Bavarian in Bavarian Alps, Tyrol, Styria, including the Heanzian dialect of Burgenland, Carinthia, northern Italy, and part of Gottschee. Germany: North Bavarian: north of Regensburg, to Nuremburg and Western Bohemia, Czech Republic; Central Bavarian: Alps and Salzburg; South Bavarian: Bavarian Alps, Tyrol, Styria, including the Heanzian dialect of Burgenland, Carinthia, northern Italy, and part of Gottschee in Slovenia. Italy: outh Bavarian is in Bavarian Alps, Tyrol, Styria, including Heanzian dialect of Burgenland, Carinthia, northern Italy, and part of Gottschee; Central Bavarian is in Alps, Lower Austria and Salzburg; North Bavarian north of Regensburg, to Nuremburg and Western Bohemia, Czech Republic. Also in Czech Republic.

Austria: Vorarlberg (Grosses Walsertal: Blons, Fontanella, Raggal, St. Gerold, Sonntag, Thüringerberg); Kleinwalsertal (Mittleberg); Brandnertal (Brand); Montafon (Silbertal); Reintal (Laterns); Tannberg (Schricken, Lech, Warth); Tirol: Paznauntal (Galtnr). 14 communities. Italy: Valle d’Aosta: Val Lesa (Val del Lys) (Gressoney, Issime, Gaby); Piemonte: Valsesia (Alagna, Rima S. Giuseppe, Rimella), Novara: Valle Anzasca (Macugnaga); Val Formazza (Formazza, Pomatt). 9 communities. Liechtenstein: Triesenberg, including Saminatal and Malbun. 1 community.

Also in Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Egypt, Estonia, France, Georgia, Greece, Honduras, Hungary, India, Iraq, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Lebanon, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Syria, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, United States, Uzbekistan.

child.geography: Greece: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Cyprus: Nearly all in south Cyprus. Egypt: Alexandria. France: Cargese, Corsica. Italy: South, east of Reggio; Salento (Colimera, Sternatía, Zollino) and Aspromonte (Bova, Condofuri, Palizzi, Roccoforte, Roghudi). Turkey (Europe): Istanbul City. Ukraine: Donetsk Oblast, Mariupol town. 18 villages. Albania: South. Also in Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.
